body_html:
@asimshankar
Thanks for noting me that there is a function named Graph.operation(String name), it is really useful and it could be further improved with a function like Graph.getOperations() which returns a list of operations in the graph. This would allow us the inspect the graph directly and see if the correct one is loaded.

I'm thinking about the empty graph behavior, since it seems like an odd thing to load an empty graph on purpose?

I know this happened because of a simple bug in my code but it was just a bit hard to track with the current api. I loaded an empty graph :(.
body_text:
@asimshankar
Thanks for noting me that there is a function named Graph.operation(String name), it is really useful and it could be further improved with a function like Graph.getOperations() which returns a list of operations in the graph. This would allow us the inspect the graph directly and see if the correct one is loaded.
I'm thinking about the empty graph behavior, since it seems like an odd thing to load an empty graph on purpose?
I know this happened because of a simple bug in my code but it was just a bit hard to track with the current api. I loaded an empty graph :(.
body:
@asimshankar 
Thanks for noting me that there is a function named `Graph.operation(String name)`, it is really useful and it could be further improved with a function like `Graph.getOperations()` which returns a list of operations in the graph. This would allow us the inspect the graph directly and see if the correct one is loaded. 

I'm thinking about the empty graph behavior, since it seems like an odd thing to load an empty graph on purpose?

I know this happened because of a simple bug in my code but it was just a bit hard to track with the current api. I loaded an empty graph :(.
